data.title: good
data.text: Room were good ,they have honest people working for them we left our sons Tablet and headphones with his wallet and they turn it in . The food was delish in the restaurant easy to find a lot of shopping and places to eat

data.title: For a Conference
data.text: Older property that definitely needs updating. Grounds very nice and spacious.  Out of season so the pool was closed but it looked nice.  Bathroom small but clean. Like the sink outside the bathroom to facilitate more than one person getting ready in the morning. Beds comfortable. Great staff. Check in quick.  Olivia at the front desk very efficient and pleasant.  Wait staff for our luncheon very attentive.

data.title: Feedback
data.text: I got one of the renovated rooms. Although the room was very nice, there was hardly any pressure (water) in the sink. The shower had no hot water whatsoever.

data.title: Anniversary Staycation
data.text: My husband and I got marries at this property when it was the "Rio Rancho INN".  I thought renting the honeymoon suite for our anniversary would be a wonderful surprise for my husband. We checked in the room about 4:30 pm.  We went to the room to drop off our things and go to dinner.  The cleanliness of the room was very disappointing (dead bugs in the window sill, dirty carpets and dried urine on the seat in the bathroom) as was the bed which we were not able to sleep in because wen my husband and I sat at the edge of the bed the back of the mattress lifted on the opposite side.

data.title: Needs upgrades badly.
data.text: This motel was the top of the line at one time. It still could be, but needs some help. I didn't mind the torn curtains, but I did not have hot water for the two day I stayed. Great location, just needs help.

data.title: the stay was ok
data.text: The hotel was clean and overall in decent shape.  My only real concern was there was no hot water.  They told me when I checked out that one of their boilers had gone out.  Plus there were 5 teams from the state cross country championship staying there.  The appearance of the room was ok and the place was quiet, which is always a bonus.  I was a bit surprised with the old school tv's though. flat screens have been out for several years. now.

data.title: Not good at all
data.text: The desk clerk was wonderful. The room was adequate at best, the bathroom was small and outdated. The other guests were incredibly loud and disrespectful. They squirted ketchup packets all over our car.

data.title: We love staying here!
data.text: Comfortable and homey. We love staying here. We visit our parents in Rio Rancho 2-3 times a year and always have a good time at this motel. Toro Bar has amazing burgers and the free/inexpensive breakfast and free coffee all day is a welcome amenity.

owner_response.author: Olivia M, Front Office Manager at Howard Johnson Rio Rancho/Albuquerque North, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you Roni R
 Your review means so much and we are thrilled to learn you enjoyed your stay.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice but not "great"
data.text: Our room 233 is in definite need of updating. Jet tub did not work which was disappointing. Some of the trim and such was broken and the bed/pillows were stiff. The big issue we had was the WiFi was so freaking bad. Hubby tried to update his apple watch which should have only taken a few minutes. After 2 nights still had not updated. He was able to get it done at home in 3 minutes.

owner_response.author: Olivia M, Front Office Manager at Howard Johnson Rio Rancho/Albuquerque North, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you Heatherv70 for taking the time to write your review about our property. We value all of our guests reviews and will be using it as a learning tool to better accommodate our future guests.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: stayed 3 nights while visiting in-laws
data.text: I was a little apprehensive about staying here when i first walked into the room and saw the 1980's style bed spreads and feared they hadn't been washed since then. Aside from that, the room and bathroom were spotless. Our room was on the ground floor, right hand side, near the back.  We had an air conditioning unit but I didn't see one in some of the other rooms. The bathroom was small and the hot water in the shower never really got hot. There is a courtyard with tables spread out and a pool. It was nice to be able to walk out the door and have morning coffee and afternoon cocktails outside. We stayed mid-week the week after the balloon festival so it was quiet. We did meet some of the other guests and everyone was friendly.  We enjoyed the bar in the hotel restaurant and James the bartender was very personable. Despite my initial apprehensions, I would stay here again and it made me realize how much I miss the "old fashioned" motor lodge.

owner_response.author: Olivia M, Front Office Manager at Howard Johnson Rio Rancho/Albuquerque North, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Valued Guest.
 Thank you so much for your review. I am super excited you enjoyed your stay.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Is any body home??
data.text:
Though I enjoy the landscape and layout of the Howard Johnson in Rio Rancho the Welcoming was not so great I waited in the lobby for around 15 to 20 minutes no one to be seen as I called the office form the phone in the lobby no one answered .. it was late and my wife and children were in our vehicle waiting as well my wife decided to call from her cell and aan answered stating he would be there shortly ??? Only five minutes later a man in a beanie and blue jacked came from around the corner .... Very weird experience.. 
The breakfast crew where great they need more up beat personal at the front desk.🤔

owner_response.author: Olivia M, Front Office Manager at Howard Johnson Rio Rancho/Albuquerque North, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Benny 2980,
 I am sorry you were not welcomed with more hospitality. I know sometimes we have to step away from behind the desk to help guests. 
Thank you for sharing your review and know we will correct this issue. Thank you
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Excellent Service, Funky Odor
data.text:
Friendly staff and great service were what we expected and received.

I know that there is an ongoing remodel at the inn, but our room had a really funky odor to it - perhaps that of a room that used to be smoking but hasn't been uses thataway in quite some time.

owner_response.author: Olivia M, Front Office Manager at Howard Johnson Rio Rancho/Albuquerque North, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Valued Guest.
 Thank you for your review and expressing how well our hotel staff treated you during your stay. I know they work hard to ensure all of our guests have the best of stays.
Thank you again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Overall a nice clean hotel, although slightly outdated.Very...
data.text: Overall a nice clean hotel, although slightly outdated.Very beautiful courtyard with a nice library. Bar service was okay, but very understanding. Location was great with lots of services surrounding and on a busy street but still quiet. Breakfast was very simple, nothing hot and fresh. Just coffee, hot water, fruit, and pastries.

owner_response.author: Olivia M, Front Office Manager at Howard Johnson Rio Rancho/Albuquerque North, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear samanthalY6741
 Thank you for your review. We are so excited to learn you had a good stay.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Attend Funeral
data.text:
Stay was good, but only one problem was the bathtub drain would backup when taken
a shower. We didn't report it due to the we were busy with funeral arrangements.

owner_response.author: Olivia M, Front Office Manager at Howard Johnson Rio Rancho/Albuquerque North, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear, 648mercedesm,
 We are sorry you had to come and visit under the circumstances. 
Thank you for choosing our hotel for your lodging. We are glad that you did enjoy your stay.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: hotel needs remodeling
data.text: I stay at this hotel because it is close to where family members live. I have booked here many times mainly for that reason. This last visit happened to take place during the Balloon Festival, which meant room prices were raised. At this price, then, the hotel is not a good value. At more reasonable rates, shortcomings-mostly having to do with the age of the courtyard rooms-can be overlooked. The staff worked hard to make us as comfortable as possible.

owner_response.author: Olivia M, Front Office Manager at Howard Johnson Rio Rancho/Albuquerque North, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear 921667rd,
 Thank you for sharing your review. I am glad to know my hotel staff did work hard to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Thank you
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Don't Stay Here!
data.text: This hotel is in SERIOUS need of repairs.  The bathrooms have NO HOT WATER.  Showers are luke warm at best after running the water (as instructed) for 15-20 minutes.  Management even told me the pipes and building were old.  I replied that wasn't an excuse; that they either needed to REPAIR, UPDATE, REMODEL  OR CLOSE-DOWN!!  I did receive credit on my room, but still charged regular room price considering they upcharged the rooms for the Balloon Fiesta.   It also took me multiple trips to the front desk and a lot of time to get my account to balance out correctly as staff couldn't figure out their own computer system.  VERY FRUSTRATING!!

owner_response.author: Olivia M, Front Office Manager at Howard Johnson Rio Rancho/Albuquerque North, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Rhondal66,
 Thank you so much for your review.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: I won't stay at another HoJos
data.text:
I never did get a hot shower. The light on the phone was blinking during my stay. No one on staff could help me get it turned off. The air handler sounded like there was a shower curtain tangled in the fan.  The buffet breakfast was not much to speak of. Mostly bread and cereal. The bread that was avaluable was cold and there were no tongs to remove them to your plate. I ordered breakfast one morning but the order went to the wrong table where another guest took a bite out of the meal. I was going to be late so I took it and cut away the part that had been touched. It made no difference, the sausage gravy was tasteless, the biscuits tasted like they had gone rancid and the scrambled eggs were hard and browned. 
It's a shame the an American icon like Howard Johnsons has fallen so low.
I

owner_response.author: Olivia M, Front Office Manager at Howard Johnson Rio Rancho/Albuquerque North, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Valued Guest.
 I am sorry to learn you did not have an enjoyable stay with us.
Please know your review will be printed and shared with our staff as a learning tool so we can ensure this does not happen again.
Thank you for your time and your review.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Don't stay here
data.text: This hotel has fallen into disrepair. Don't be fooled by the pictures of the lobby.  I had hot water for a shower most days.  The Internet was only available for a total of 30 minutes of my 6 day stay and it was very slow when it worked.  The room needs new paint, furniture and fixtures.  Only one ice machine worked in the whole hotel. With all of the locking gates and fences it felt like I was in a minimum  security prison. The room had a weird musty smell. The housekeeping staff did a good job with what they had to work with and the towels were soft. If I could have found a hotel with vacancies nearby I would have left.

owner_response.author: Olivia M, Front Office Manager at Howard Johnson Rio Rancho/Albuquerque North, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear matthewnY5162GZ,
 Thank you for taking the time to write your review about your stay. We are working on the issues you have mentioned.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Multiple Moves
data.text: The first room we had didn't have hot water. They moved us to a second room, which had slightly warmer water, but with two queen sized beds, instead of a King. We slept there the first night. The second night, we were moved to the third room which had a King sized bed, and much warmer water. We slept very well in that room. I found each room was decorated differently than the other. Each room had different quality of towels too. There was a hint of mold growing in the corners of the showers, but there wasn't any smell associated with it. The front desk people were helpful, most especially Dalisia.  Thank you Dalisia for finding us a room that fit with warmer water! The continental breakfast stops early, so I can't tell you anything about that. The pool was warm enough to go swimming even in October.

owner_response.author: Olivia M, Front Office Manager at Howard Johnson Rio Rancho/Albuquerque North, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Charlenerex
 Thank you for writing your review. I am so happy to know our staff took care of you and also good to know you were able to enjoy our pool before is was drained for the season.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Decent Place to stay but had issues
data.text: We stayed at the HJ in Rio Rancho for 9 nights and had our share of issues. The first night the handle of the shower broke off and they provided us with a key to another room so we could take a shower down there since the plumber could not come in until Saturday. Then after he finished and we returned from working at the Balloon Fiesta the water in the sink in the kitchenette would not come on. I tried to turn it on below the sink but it was leaking. The plumber came back on Sunday to fix this issue. Another no nap day. The rest of the week was the normal - not enough towels/ toilet paper and such. but to end up the week we had the AC blowing while we were at the Fiesta and when we returned the room was hotter then it was outside. I called the front desk and was told that "they" turned on the heaters because of the "freeze warning". All we could do was open the doors and get a fan from maintenance to circulate the air. Other then that the beds were nice and comfy and the room is very large. But I don't plan to stay there again. Especially if they close off all the outside doors.

owner_response.author: Olivia M, Front Office Manager at Howard Johnson Rio Rancho/Albuquerque North, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Bernadette L,
 Thank you for your review about your stay. We do our best to make sure all of our guests are comfortable.
owner_response.title: Owner Response
